scenario_text.value: Oh, Aoi? Have you seen Kaito?
Nope, I haven’t.

I just feel so bad about it all... I wish I’d
stopped him from going to the library.

Come on, Aoi. Hindsight’s always 20/20, but
we can’t blame ourselves for everything.

You made the right decision calling everyone
back.
Yeah...

(Seems like she’ll feel responsible no matter
what I say.)
(But she really did do the right thing.)

(If she hadn’t called everyone back, both she
and Kaito would’ve been in trouble.)
(I wish I could get her to understand that.)
(How do I convince her she’s in the right?)
He wouldn’t mind.
You helped us all.
We owe you a lot.
He wouldn’t mind.

Kaito wouldn’t hold your actions against you.
He would understand.

Don’t talk like that! You make it sounds like
he’s gone forever.
Ah, s-sorry... I didn’t mean it like that.

I just meant you don’t need to feel
responsible for everything that happened.
Right. Sorry, I’ll be careful.

(I sure hope Aoi will feel a little more at
ease now...)
You helped us all.
You really helped us out back there.

Speaking of 20/20 vision, your actions
deserve some credit in retrospect.

Maybe... I sure don’t feel good about them
now, though.

But you should. We made it this far thanks to
you.

We’ll find Kaito eventually. So cheer up a
little, okay?
Right... Thanks, Takuma.
We owe you a lot.

It’s thanks to you that we made it this far
at all.

If you hadn’t done what you did, Kaito
wouldn’t be the only one in harm’s way.

So don’t be so hard on yourself. We actually
benefited from what you did.
Takuma...

All we have to do is find Kaito, and then
everything will be solved.
So don’t be so hard on yourself. ’Kay?

Hmm... So you’re saying my actions did some
good, too?
That makes me feel better. Thanks, Takuma.

I’ll look around here a bit longer and then
head back to school.
